characters: IT IS THE SAME OLD WOMAN THAT ELISE SAW.
SOMEONE IS RIGHT THERE IN HIS FACE. A MAN.
T E R R O R.
--TO SEE DALTON SITTING NEXT TO HIM. STARING AT HIM.
THE MAN IS NOW IN THE ROOM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A spherical black monolith rises up from a white surface. white like the moon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the darkness, the towers metal skin is barely visible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We ROTATE AROUND, revealing the tower to actually be a LA not rising up from a surface, but hanging down from a whi ceiling. The bulb unlit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Directly below the lamp is the very definition of innocen a sleeping child. Chest rising and falling with each brea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We HOVER over the young boy...watching him. A blanket emblazoned with dinosaurs is draped across his limbs. His mouth is slack, eyelids twitching to dreams unseen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truly deep sleep that an adult can only wish for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We move away from him, exploring the dark room. Strewn wi toys. The door is slightly ajar. We float through it into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --a long hallway. Even darker than the bedroom. And witho the boys rhythmic breathing, even quieter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A window at the end of the hall enlarges as we approach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone is standing in front of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The murky silhouette of the figure turns and walks away. follow it, tentative. Turning a corner, we see the figure Standing in a doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we can make out the edges of the person. It is an old woman. Hair in a Victorian bun. A corseted dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares at us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OPENING TITLES play out to the shrill screams of George Crumb's `Black Angels I: Night Of The Electric Insects'. 3.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eyes flick open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A woman blinks awake, gazing around the room. Another bedroom. Sparse. Just a bed and a cabinet. It is 5.43 AM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her eyes settle on the man lying next to her in the dark. heaving snores have woken her up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is RENAI (pronounced Renee) LAMBERT (36). With a quie determination she is holding on to her youthful good look but the lines of age are creeping in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has settled into the `comfort' years of a marriage: h pinned up messily, wearing dowdy pajamas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She beholds her husband, taking him in. Considering him. snorts and smacks his lips. Very unflattering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She climbs out of bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High ceilings. Exposed beams. Spanish style windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai treads across wooden floorboards into a sunken livi room. No matter careful she is, there is a loud creak wit each step. A GRANDFATHER CLOCK in the corner ticks steadi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is barely any furniture in here, only a BOOKCASE an PIANO. What there is a lot of...is boxes. Large moving bo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai plops cross-legged onto the floor and rips open one the boxes, marked BOOKS. She plucks out a handful of book and lines them up on the bookshelf. Then another handful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are all self-help and self-improvement books. Titles like `Be The Better You' and `Inch By Inch, It's A Cinch: Guide To Achieving Your Goals' pop out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She spots a sealed box labelled PHOTO ALBUMS. She strips the tape and wrestles out a dusty album of wedding photos

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiling faces greet her as she thumbs through the pages. happy couple. Young. Glowing. Sadness washes over her.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She snaps out of it and turns to see DALTON LAMBERT (8). son. He approaches her, rubbing his eyes. (It is not the we saw in the opening scene.) 4.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing up, kiddo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like my room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll get used to it. It's only your first night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He climbs into her lap. She bites on his ear playfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Argh, I'm going to eat you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you looking at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just some photos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What photos?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hefts another album from the box, prying it open. A p of a grinning young girl greets them, hair in pigtails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know who that is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't look like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I'm so happy there. But it's me. When I was your age. I was a kid once too, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you weren't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai bursts out laughing. She is famous for her big laug

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. Maybe you're right...I don't remember being this person at all. I hope she smiled like that all the time, whoever she was. 5.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sizes up her son. The living embodiment of the photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a terrible thing to admit, Dalton, but sometimes I get jealous of you. That you're so young. That you haven't made any of your decisions yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't wanna grow old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it starts happening to us from the moment we're born.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She points to the hands on the grandfather clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every time that clock ticks, we all get a little bit older.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns the page in the photo album, seeing an old man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's your grandpa. You wouldn't remember him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smells like smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...good memory. He did smoke that god awful pipe, didn't he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show me a picture of dad when he was a little kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't even know if we have any. He's hopeless with keeping photos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show me a picture of me when I was a little kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your pictures are all in the computer. Nobody keeps photo albums like this anymore, they're ancient relics. They should. I like being able to touch something, instead of it floating around in cyber world. If the laptop breaks, your whole existence is erased. 6.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was I like when I was a little kid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are a little kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kisses him on the forehead and stares into his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If only you knew what I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear a baby crying off screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You certainly didn't cry as much as your little sister does. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chaos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boxes of dinnerware have not been unpacked yet and it is turning the usual morning routine into a nightmare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai is on the phone as her kids buzz around a kitchen i at top speed, creating a high-energy, manic pace in the r

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billing department.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her son FOSTER (6), tugs on her leg, holding a box of cer

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a bowl, mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai rips open a box, rifling through newspaper, phone wedged against her shoulder. She holds out a cup, fluster

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billing department.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too small.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make it work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speak to an agent. Speak to an agent. Speak to an agent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foster slumps on the floor, pouring cereal and overflowin into the cup. A baby girl in a high chair, CALI (2), sque 7.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOSH LAMBERT (37) gapes into the mirror, face covered in soap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He washes it off. Now he's awake we see that he is a hand clean-cut guy - a former high school nerd who got revenge growing into his body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sorts through a box labelled JOSH'S BATHROOM STUFF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes out two bottles - TONER and MOISTURIZER. He dabs toner on, then smooths the moisturizer into his forehead around his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He suddenly notices a grey hair. Looks mortified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Michael Corleone voice) Every time I think I've pulled you out...you grow back in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He plucks it out, wincing melodramatically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ouch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh strides in, tie hanging open around his neck. Renai still on the phone. Josh points to his tie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'd like to keep the old number if I could.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really need to learn how to do this, honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She threads the tie into a knot for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't eat on the floor, buddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foster stays where he is, slurping cereal from the cup. Dalton is playing a handheld videogame. Intensely focused

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, well, please let me know by the end of today, I have to give the number out. Thank you. 8.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hangs up, pissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foster, get up. Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foster frowns and obeys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come you were up so early? Was Cali crying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You woke me up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were snoring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No I wasn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes you were.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't snore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father snored. I do not snore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How would you know what you do? You're asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai marches out of the room. Dalton's game unit beeps loudly and he pumps his fist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! I made it to the last level! Invisiworld!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever amiable, Josh high five's his son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good one, champ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't snore, do I? 9.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai sees that all the books she unpacked earlier are no scattered across the floor of the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are my bleeping pills?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai charges in. Josh snatches an apple out of a fruit b biting into it. He quickly gags and spits it out into the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the heck is this? Wax?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me get this straight - we have no actual fruit but we have wax fruit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is dangerous. It could kill one of our kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are my pills, Josh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably where you left them, Renai.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She finds them on the counter, snatching them up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not where I left them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, I need my lunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, geez. Look, just...take last night's dinner. 10.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens the fridge. It is bare except for a box of sush

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sushi? Aw, that's weirdo food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all we have. Just for today, honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check it first, Dalton. It's probably made out of Styrofoam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And while I've got you, if you're going to look at my books, please don't leave them all over the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't touch your books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh streaks past, kissing Renai on the cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you taking the boys to school?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well can you pick them up after school?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I have stuff I wanted to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She trails off. He's gone. Foster BURPS. Loudly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I have another cup, mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noisy students settle into their desks. Inner city kids, mostly Hispanic. 11.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh is their teacher, scribbling on the blackboard. One student, a lanky boy, ALANSO (16), hovers near the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alanso, please sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No entiendo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SiГ©ntate, por favor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alanso takes a seat. Josh is having trouble getting contr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on guys, quieten down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pretty girl in the front, TERI, is annoyed at the class

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better all shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She commands respect. They do. Except for one kid.

dialogues.speaker: THE ONE KID
dialogues.text: Just cos you're in love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Teri. Today we are going to talk about Darwin. It's a city in Australia, but it's also the last name of which famous naturalist?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles Darwin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Correct. Does anybody know what he is famous for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said that people descended from monkeys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half right. He wrote a seminal book that explained his theories on natural selection, and how the different species on this planet - including humans - evolved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know I didn't evolve from no monkey. Shit. 12.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Humans actually have a lot in common with monkeys, or more specifically, chimpanzees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you do, but I was created in the image of my Dios.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a gold cross hanging on a necklace out of his sh kissing it and holding it up. That gets another laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I respect your right to believe that, Alanso. But I want to give you all possible theories. I want this class to go out into the world with an informed opinion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The theory is incorrect, Mr. Lambert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can it be incorrect? It's a theory. A scientific theory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, science is bullshit. We didn't get here cos of no test-tubes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alanso, if you keep talking like that I'm going to ask you to visit the principal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets up and leaves as the class JEERS and BOOS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peace and quiet at last.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai gropes in behind the bookcase, plucking a hidden je box free. She pinches a cigarette out of it and lights it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sits down at her piano, feeling the keys, warming her fingers up. Sunlight streams in through the windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes out a notebook, filled with scribbled handwriti 13.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She places the notebook on the sheetstand, then sets a sm mechanical METRONOME in motion and begins tapping out a s melody in time with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm looking west, always been looking that way, gonna get it all happening, just can't do it today...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops and makes a note in her book. She starts over, rising to the emotion of the song. She's got a good voice

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm looking west, always been looking that way, I'm gonna be somebody, I just can't be her today--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is interrupted by the tinny sound of a baby crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops playing and looks over at a baby monitor, the source of the noise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai deflates, her shoulders sagging in defeat. She clos her notebook and leaves the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai scoops up Cali, rocking her gently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A scratching sound interrupts. Rough. Frantic. Like a dog pawing at something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai steps into the hall, curious. She can still hear it She follows the sound to a door. Grabs the door handle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound abruptly ceases.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door whines open and stabs a blade of light onto a se stairs that descend into a gloomy basement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai stands at the top of the stairs, squinting into the inky blackness, straining to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches up and yanks a light chain, illuminating a ba bulb and throwing light across the tenebrous space. 14.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The basement is large and completely bare. Cleaned out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai takes a step down. She is still carrying Cali.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FURTHER DOWN below her, we see that there is one step tha cracked and broken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes another step. The broken step is right below he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One more step and she will fall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cali squeals happily. Renai pauses...then turns around, heading back up the stairs. Stops when she sees something

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEEP, VIOLENT SCRATCH MARKS...running downwards on the in of the door...as if someone were trying to claw their way

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Spanish-style home. Very pretty. This is not the suburb More of an inner city neighborhood. There's history here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh pulls into the driveway of his new house in his Suba

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house almost looks liveable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foster is watching loud, zany cartoons on TV. Cali is in high chair. Renai is folding boxes. She has unpacked most the living room and is very tired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh ambles in, sees the work Renai has done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at this. Nice job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foster bolts over and crashes into his dads legs, hugging

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, buddy. Slow down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh, where's the box of my lamps?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. They should be here. We packed them up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I packed them. They're not here. 15.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember the movers bringing them in and putting them right there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, they're not here. I would know, I've been unpacking this stuff all day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dalton wanders the hall, sporting a red superhero CAPE an carrying a plastic, glowing light-sabre toy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches a door. The basement door. He pulls it open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dalton holds up his light-sabre, the glow allowing him to make out the murky corners of the basement below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a step down the stairs. Then another step.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The broken step is right below him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He steps again --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and falls. Flails forward, tumbling down the steps, al the way to the bottom. His light sabre SHATTERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hits the ground, his head smacking the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All is dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh sits with Foster, zoned out in front of the droning

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pitch black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dazed, Dalton sits up. His head is cut and bleeding. He i alone in the dark. He stares into the corner of the surrounding cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes adjust, making out a shape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shadow. 16.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh and Renai look up as the quiet is shattered by a SCR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They spring into action, scrambling to their feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dalton? Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't answer. Just keeps screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai and Josh whip the door open, glaring into the basem from the top of the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dalton?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dalton is crumpled at the bottom of the steps, sobbing, h red cape gathered around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai flicks the light on. Her and Josh scamper down the steps, propping Dalton up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I fell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dalton, you have to be careful. You shouldn't be coming down here in the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do you hurt the most?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My knee and my head. I can't stand up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh lifts him to his feet. A severely grazed knee is dot with blood. He's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You scared us, champ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh carries him up the stairs as he sucks in sobs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai glances around the basement, her eyes landing on th lone object that resides in it. 17.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She frowns. It wasn't there when she saw the basement las

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a box. One of her large, cardboard moving boxes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is marked LAMPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dalton is lying in bed, a band-aid slapped across his forehead. Renai tucks him in, Josh standing over him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're lucky you don't need stitches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I catch you falling down the stairs again I'm gonna break your neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That doesn't make sense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are dozens of pictures tacked to the wall, all draw Dalton. Josh taps one; a drawing of Dalton flying through night sky, wearing his cape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You might be a superhero but you're not invincible. Be more careful, bud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai kisses him and gets up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sleep tight, honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They wave goodbye and turn out the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai flops into bed beside Josh, exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've gotta lock that door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's such a boy. He goes off exploring. Sometimes I wanna keep him on one of those child leashes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why bother with a child leash? I'll stop at the pet store tomorrow. 18.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She laughs and cuddles up to him, resting her head on his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I was pissy when you got home. I was trying to work on a song today and then Cali woke up and wouldn't stop crying...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't even notice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel guilty for wanting my own time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's normal to want your own time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it? My mother gave up everything for me. I keep waiting for the completely selfless parent gene to kick in, but I'm exactly the same person I was when I was 22, only now I'm married with kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a great mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm not. They like you so much better than me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the cool dad who comes home with presents and I'm the one who yells at them all day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you're being crazy. They love you. At least you get to connect with them. I work so much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe me, you're their hero. They try to play us off against each other. They're master manipulators. I guess they really are my kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh laughs. A lull settles over them. 19.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this it, Josh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this so bad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't answer. They sit in silence for a long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for letting me take some time off to work on my music again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll get by. I want you to do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a couple of songs...I mean not all of them, but there's a couple of them that I think are really good. And I think, maybe I could do something with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love all your songs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is 3AM. All the remoteness of that hour is present here...we can feel it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As still and quiet as deep space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The formerly bustling kitchen is now a museum at midnight

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long, dark thoroughfare. A ticking clock its only occup

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stairs swallowed up by darkness. The groan of settling wo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soft breathing of a sleeping child. 20.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hanging toy birds dangle over the baby, tinkling in a bre

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dalton is sleeping too. Impossibly still. Lying on his ba

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai and Josh are entwined together. Josh is snoring. Th are both blissfully asleep...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...for now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another day, another chaotic breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foster waves a stuffed toy around. Josh charges in, bits tissue on his face from shaving cuts. Cali flails her arm her high chair. Renai is at the sink, whisking eggs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foster, sit down honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She whips a look around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is...? Hey Josh, could you go wake up Dalton?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We FOLLOW Josh as he marches down the corridor to Dalton' bedroom, poking his head inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh knocks on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time to get up, my man. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing from Dalton. He doesn't even stir. Josh rolls his eyes and walks in. Nudges Dalton with his knee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're making me look bad here. Outta bed before your mother comes in and kills both of us. 21.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. He's really out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh reaches down and shakes Dalton vigorously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dalton, get up. You've gotta get ready for school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh waits for a response, but none comes. Dalton is as s as a puppet. Something resembling concern crosses Josh's

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dalton...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kneels down, shaking Dalton hard. He listens for breat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dalton? Dalton?! DALTON!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His scream takes us into--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --the stern sterility of a hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh and Renai, eyes lined by dark circles, stand in fron a dour neurologist, DR. JOEL SERCARZ (46).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai dabs her eyes with a tissue. They are red with tear Beyond a window in front of them, lying on a gurney in an chamber, is the unconscious body of Dalton.

dialogues.speaker: DR. SERCARZ
dialogues.text: Okay...as of yet, our tests have not drawn any conclusive answers for you. Repeated blood and CSF cultures are normal, making an infective origin highly unlikely. Tests for Lyme disease and repeated polymerase chain reaction are negative. Systemic vasculitis was ruled out. Dalton remains in an areactive coma without focal signs or abnormal brainstem reflexes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh and Renai struggle to follow the cold, multi-syllabl medical terminology...like stranded tourists keeping up w a foreign language.

dialogues.speaker: DR. SERCARZ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We've looked for bacterial pathogens like Meningoencephalitis, but haven't seen anything.

dialogues.speaker: DR. SERCARZ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I wouldn't say we've exhausted every single angle...but we're close. The underlying cause is still unknown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh and Renai look in at their boy.

dialogues.speaker: DR. SERCARZ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The good news is that he's breathing without the use of a mechanical apparatus, and there are no lesions or hemorrhages in any of the CT scans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So...there's no brain damage or...?

dialogues.speaker: DR. SERCARZ
dialogues.text: None that we've detected. Technically, he's in a coma. He doesn't respond to stimuli, he has no sleep-wake cycle, but there's no brain trauma or infection. His scans are normal. To be honest, I've never seen anything like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That fall he took...I mean, it looked like he hit his head pretty hard.

dialogues.speaker: DR. SERCARZ
dialogues.text: We definitely exhausted that possibility, but it was always doubtful. The cut was superficial, there wasn't even a skull fracture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't just not wake up...there's got to be something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai sobs, tears streaming down her face. Josh looks lik deer in the headlights. Stunned dumb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sercarz clears his throat. This part of the job isn't his specialty.

dialogues.speaker: DR. SERCARZ
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do we do now? Does he stay here?

dialogues.speaker: DR. SERCARZ
dialogues.text: We'll conduct some further testing, but beyond that...I really don't know. 23.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His pager goes off. He checks it.

dialogues.speaker: DR. SERCARZ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Excuse me for a minute. I have to step out. A nurse will be with you in just a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leaves quickly. Josh and Renai press on the glass, separated in body and spirit from their son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ghastly meld of hospital room and young boys bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dalton lies on his bed, a heart rate monitor hooked to hi chest. IV tubes run into his arms, a Nasogastric feeding into his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A young nurse, ADELE CHALFIN (30), checks the various tub as Renai watches on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you having any more trouble with the feeding tube?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai looks broken, the life drained from her. A wilted f She shakes her head, her voice a low rasp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, well I'll be back soon. I'll bring some new books. You're probably sick of the ones you have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he respond to any of the tests?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adele pauses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...no, he didn't. But we have to give it time. I've seen coma patients with a much longer inactivity time suddenly start making noises. 24.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not in a coma, remember? They don't know what to call it. They don't know what to do with him so they've given up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, they haven't. We're going to figure it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adele hugs her, then exits. Renai slumps down on a chair to her son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The heart rate monitor pings. Dalton is as still as a sta

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai shuffles down the corridor. She passes a bedroom do then stops and doubles back, pushing it open and going in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --the babies room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares into the crib...at her other sleeping baby. Sh sets the baby monitor and walks out softly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai slumps in front of her piano. Taps one of the keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She plays a discordant melody of low notes with one hand, present enough to hear it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops and buries her face in her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then she hears it. Whispering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's so low you would miss it if the house wasn't absolut silent. Renai looks up, scanning for the source of the mu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is coming from the baby monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Confused, Renai picks up the monitor, turning up the volu all the way up. The hissssssss of static fills the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She presses her ear to the device, then hears it again - hushed WHISPER, almost indistinct from the static save fo the whistle of sibilants. 25.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They see us...all of us...we have to be quick...this life begs us to come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whisper trails off....more static...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai drops the baby monitor, leaping out of her skin at sound of the scream. Nerves fried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The monitor smashes on the floor. All is quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai moves to the door, staring down the corridor at the door to Cali's nursery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is open only a crack. She hears crying. Cali is crying

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We follow her as she bolts towards the nursery, smashing through the door, eyes filled with terror, seeing--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai stalks into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is empty, save for Cali, crying in her crib. Ren eyes land on the closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through a slight crack, we see Renai approach. Breath quivering. Her hand reaches out. She FLINGS the door open

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The family is eating. It's very quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foster keeps his eyes down as his parents eat in silence. Suddenly Cali breaks the quiet, squealing happily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dadda!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh looks up, smiling. Amazed. 26.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She said dad...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither Renai nor Foster even look up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bedside lamp gives off a jaundice glow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai gathers up scattered toys from the floor, relocatin them to a desktop covered in beakers and lab equipment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foster lies in bed beneath a large chart of the solar sys

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai stops cleaning when she finds a certificate, crumpl next to a school bag. It says IN RECOGNITION OF SCIENCE SKILL, AWARDED TO FOSTER LAMBERT ON 3/14/10.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An award.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's today's date. You got this today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foster nods meekly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you tell us, honey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sits on the edge of his bed. He stares at the wall. S strokes his hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it's hard right now. But things will get better. I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foster nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to show this to your dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She plants a kiss his forehead and stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm scared, mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scared of what? 27.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dalton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai sits back down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're all scared. It's normal to be scared for him. But we can't give up--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do I have to sleep so close to him? Can't I change rooms?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would you wanna change rooms?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foster swallows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai stares at her son. She kisses him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your brother needs you. Goodnight honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh lies in bed, reading Foster's award. Renai is beside

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something happened today. I didn't want to tell you in front of Foster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard something coming from Cali's room. A man's voice. On the baby monitor...it scared the hell outta me. I went in there and no one was there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could it have been interference?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. It was so clear. I was sitting at the piano and I heard this...whispering on the baby monitor. So I held my ear up to it-- 28.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUDDENLY - a noise interrupts. An arrhythmic KNOCKING sou like a drunk pounding on a tavern door after closing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the hell is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh knows it's his job to check, but he doesn't want to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh approaches the front door, flashlight in hand. He pe through curtains at the front step.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too dark to see anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Who's there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only the wind replies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He aims the flashlight at the glass, shining it into the thick darkness. There is no one on the front step.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh presses the flashlight against the window, arcing th beam across his front garden. Leans in close to the glass

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. There's no one there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He makes sure the door is locked, then flips open a secur system panel on the wall, pecking at the buttons on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai sits up in bed, listening. Hears nothing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...until the low moans of a baby crying float out of the monitor. Renai hurls the sheet aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai pads down the hall, tentative. 29.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches the open door to Cali's room. Sees the silhou of Josh standing over Cali's crib. Exhales with relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was it, Josh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh appears at the opposite end of the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai SCREAMS as the silhouette recedes into the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's someone in there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She RUNS towards Josh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's someone in Cali's room!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh BOLTS down the hall, flicking on the light, terrifie

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nursery is empty. Cali is sleeping. Terrified, Josh enters the room. Scans around. Only toys and colorful wallpaper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He steps in further. He's not cut out for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house alarm screams to deafening life, shaving a few years off Josh's life in the process. He JOLTS, whipping around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grab Cali and Foster!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh charges down the hall into the--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --snatching up a fire poker from the fireplace and contin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- to the front door, which is swinging open. Holding the fire poker aloft, Josh scans the area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai races past, carrying Cali and dragging Foster behin her. They barrel toward Dalton's room. 30.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh scans the kitchen. It is empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The alarm wails in the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh inches his way up the hall, hand shaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai holds Foster and Cali close to her. Dalton is lying behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Directly across from Dalton's room is the laundry. The do is ajar, offering a view into the darkened room beyond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai sees something in the dark...a figure. A boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks like Dalton. He reaches out to Renai--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --until another HAND...a pale hand...reaches across and s the laundry door, sealing the boy off from her view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh! The laundry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh bolts up the hall, panicked. He reaches the laundry door, grabbing the handle. Hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He propels the door open with a shove, flicking on the li

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is empty. No windows, no doors for escape...just washing machine and a dryer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A home security officer trudges down the steps of the hou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai, Josh, Foster and Cali all stand outside in their pajamas, shivering in the frigid night air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no one in there, it's all clear. If someone was there, they're gone now. 31.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai steps away from the children, out of their earshot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw somebody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it was a shadow...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It wasn't a shadow, it was a man. He was tall, and he long, greasy hair. He was wearing a grey jacket. He looked right at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, like I said...he's gone now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai looks to the others. Sees only disbelieving faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh's students scuffle about on stadium seating, arrangi themselves for a CLASS PHOTO. They're not doing a great j

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A male photographer does his best to compose them, not do great job of hiding his bitterness about the fact that he shooting school photos instead of Vanity Fair spreads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, face the front ladies and gentlemen...come on...hold still... (muttering to himself) I'm trying to record the peak of your pathetic lives here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh stands off to the side, lost in his own thoughts. Ti

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Lambert, would you like to step in please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh snaps out of his own head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you step in so that we can take the photo? Quickly please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just take it without me. 32.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need you in the photo, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you don't. Just take the damn photo without me, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The class settles down, shocked by the outburst. Chastene the photographer turns to the class, gripping the camera trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe this is my life. (beat; to class) Ready kids? Say asshole teacher!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The students file out of the gym. Josh sits in the bleach head buried in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: ALANSO, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I hear things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh looks up, seeing Alanso.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I spend so much time in the office, I hear things. I heard about your son. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Alanso.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Times like these...people realize that science doesn't have all the answers. There is a higher force at work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I had your belief. Things would be a lot simpler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things are simple. You just can't see it. Put your faith in Him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He places his gold cross necklace in Josh's hand, then le Josh watches him go, then takes out his cell phone. 33.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey...I just found out I have to stay back tonight and finish off mid-term grades. It could be a while, there's a lot to go through. Don't wait up. Bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh sits on a park bench, staring into the distance. He takes out a flask of whisky, swigging from it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai lies in bed, staring at the ceiling. Alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai shuffles in, pouring herself a glass of water. Then hears it. A low muttering. It is coming from Dalton's roo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unnerved, Renai peers through the open door. Josh is sitt beside Dalton's bed, reading to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men all walked down to the waters edge...and they stood there and asked the beast to come forth. And the beast roared back "No!". And so they dived in after it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the sunlight, the house looks like a happy place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dalton's face is a picture of serenity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A new day-shift nurse, KELLY (29), checks on his feeding tube. Renai watches from the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay? 34.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was going to head off for an hour or so. Are you alright here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. Anything from Dalton?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai nods. Her eyes brim with tears. The cracks are show

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep providing him with stimuli. I've seen it work time and time again. Read to him. Even if you're doing something else, you can play him music that he likes. Don't give up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She throws a scarf over her shoulder and stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't, I just...I haven't slept much the last couple of nights. I feel like the universe is trying to see how far I can bend before I break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The universe picked a fight with the wrong chick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Kelly. You're a saint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm not. I'm doing my job. I chose to be here. You didn't choose any of this. You're the strong one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai surveys the living room. It is a total mess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water cascades out of a faucet. Steam rises from the wate 35.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai lets bath salts fall into the tub. She almost looks relaxed just smelling them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts to undress, then turns --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and YELPS in fright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A person is standing behind the distorted glass window, staring in at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shape of the person's head and shoulders can clearly seen, but the glass is too opaque to make out any feature

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai slips, grabbing the sink. When she glances up, the figure is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trembling, Renai opens the window. Very, very slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is fifteen feet off the ground, with a sheer drop belo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai sits on the front steps, alone. It is late. She loo somehow tired and wired at the same time. Smoking a cigar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh pulls in. Fumbles out of his car, tipsy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's midnight, Josh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When did you start smoking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been coming home late every single night. You've never had to do that in all of the years you've been at the school. Now all of a sudden you have to stay back late?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like it either, but I'm grading tests. What choice do I have? We've gotta pay Dalton's bills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mother is paying Dalton's bills, Josh. I know because she reminds me every chance she gets. 36.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, I can't win with you. That's my son in there too, not just yours!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He paces, the anger sobering him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've always felt like less than good enough for you. I feel it every time you mention our bills. That subtle voice that says `can't you get a job that pays more than a teacher'? And now I can't even look at you without feeling it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're projecting that onto me. You've written an entire story about I'm how I'm feeling without once asking me how I'm feeling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need to ask. I know you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am losing my mind here in this house, Josh. I'm scared and I need you and you're not here. Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you, I'm grading tests.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't mean that. I mean you're not here. With me. In this situation. You're avoiding it, like you do anything stressful, whether it's this or a parking ticket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ, I should have stayed at the school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you go again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai stands up and walks inside the house. The door clos

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh tosses a pillow onto the couch, setting himself up f the night. He curls up on it, pulling a blanket over hims 37.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The witching hour. Still. Quiet...save for the omnipresen clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dalton is as still as we've seen him. And then...he twitc A slight facial twitch, but we see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh snoozes, head arched at a bad angle. His back will regret sleeping on this couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai tosses and turns, restless in sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her eyes open and she sucks in a breath. Bad dreams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She blinks and looks around the room, surprised to be alo sitting up in fright. Until she remembers why. She eases onto the bed. Then she looks over at the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a man standing outside it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is not looking in at her...he is pacing back and forth furiously smoking a cigarette. Back and forth, back and forth. Agitated. He has long, black, greasy hair and a gr jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every muscle in Renai's body freezes. She becomes a glaci

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her eyes are drilled to the man, unable to move. By sheer will, she manages to direct them towards the bedroom door Opens her mouth but no words will come. Finally--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jo....osh....Josh....Josh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She glances back at the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He paces back and forth between the bed and the window, j as he was outside, ignoring Renai. Smoking like a fiend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then, suddenly, he stops pacing. Looks up. Straight a Renai - as if just realizing she was there. 38.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a moment their eyes are locked in silence...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and then the man's face contorts in anger and he CHARG towards her, arms outstretched, GROWLING in fury.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai lets out a SHRIEK of terror that could strip paint. cry from the depths of her soul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She propels herself backward, falling off the bed and scrambling back into the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh CHARGES into the room, flicking on the light--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --seeing only Renai, huddled in the corner, screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? What is it?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai is incoherent. She cannot stop screaming. Josh grab her by the shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai, what is wrong?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man -- he was there -- he tried to -- there was a man there!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foster runs into the room, visibly terrified. He sees his mother and instantly begins crying. He runs to his dad, holding onto his leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the background, Cali begins crying, her screams contributing to an overwhelming din.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no one here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw somebody!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no one here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you dare not believe me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe you, okay? I just don't know what you want me to do. 39.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to tell me that we can leave this house. I will not spend one more night here. I wanna leave, I wanna go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want the man to get me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The realization that her child is terrified quiets Renai.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All is suddenly silent, save for the cries of Cali in the background. Josh holds his son tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're okay, buddy. I've got you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He and Renai exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't...I want to leave this house. I can't be here anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To move now would be...we would have to rent somewhere. It's not--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Josh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An agreement passes between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moving truck is parked outside an average suburban home

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Movers mill about, hauling boxes and couches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai unpacks boxes. An elderly woman, LORRAINE (65), hel unpack. This is Josh's mother. She has a curt, disapprovi manner about her that doesn't always make her easy to lov

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is actually moving more quickly than Renai, who groan if her back were aching as she stoops down to pick up boo 40.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lorraine, you shouldn't have to do any of this. Sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nonsense. I'm perfectly capable of putting a few things away. I did it for Josh his whole life. He never was good with tidying up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, but I just feel so bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's you who should be sitting down by the looks of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She boosts a photo frame from one of the boxes. It is a portrait of Renai, Dalton, Foster and Josh. In happier ti

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lorraine seems taken aback by it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe you got Josh to sit still for a photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai reclines against the wall, surveying her new living room. Her new new house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe we're doing all this again, that's what I can't believe. (beat; looks at her) I know you think I'm crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lorraine stops unpacking and fixes Renai with a stare. Th never really gotten along before. Adversity has brought a a truce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody - not me, not anybody - knows what you're going through right now. Whatever you have to do to get through it, do it. And never apologize for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai hugs her. It's a new thing for them and a bit awkwa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. BRYCE TRIMBLE (52) sits opposite Renai and Josh. Spre out in front of him are a series of X-Rays, labelled DALT LAMBERT. His office is big and expensive. 41.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai looks hopeful. Josh looks like a shell of a man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just wanna say...thank you so much. For helping us out with this, doctor. We can't tell you how much it means to have you involved.

dialogues.speaker: DR. TRIMBLE
dialogues.text: I'm glad to help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unfortunately...these recent tests have proven inconclusive. There's absolutely nothing abnormal here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh and Renai deflate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So...if you're the top of the food chain with this stuff, where does that leave us?

dialogues.speaker: DR. TRIMBLE
dialogues.text: I don't know. There is a research team in Boston who specialize in a new form of treatment. They try to stimulate the patients brain with electric pulses. It has a good success rate with victims of brain injury. We could try that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So there's hope?

dialogues.speaker: DR. TRIMBLE
dialogues.text: There are more things we can try.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hope part is up to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai sits beside Dalton. Staring at him. She runs her fingers through his hair, touching his skin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A needle touches an LP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pops and crackles of record hiss spit forth, followed the lilting guitar strums of `Tip Toe Through The Tulips'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The quavering falsetto of Tiny Tim accompanies the guitar 42.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tip-toe by the window, by the window, that is where I'll be...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai walks away and we follow her down the hall into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- a mess as only a child can make.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai picks up a plate and a fork and knife from the floo She walks out and we DON'T CUT, tracking with her --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- back down the hall, towards the kitchen. The records continues warbling in the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh tip-toe, from the garden, by the garden, of the willow tree...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai passes the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What she doesn't see is the child standing in the middle the room, facing the record player.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy is dressed in clothes from another time, but children's clothes just the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is dancing awkwardly, shifting his weight from one foo foot the other sheepishly, as if trying it for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai keeps walking and we stay with her as she moves pas the child, following her into the --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- mess of the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sets the plate down in the sink, on top of a stack of other dirty dishes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a sigh she runs the hot water over the dishes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a sudden POP, the record starts skipping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bump...bump...bump... 43.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai shuts off the water, heading back to the living roo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She marches in, annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her bookshelf is empty. The books that once sat on it are scattered across the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bump...bump...bump...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai scans the books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Giggling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pivots her head towards the darkened hallway. There, sees a child, hidden in shadow, standing in the hall. Sta at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bump...bump...bump...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai doesn't move. Doesn't breathe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then suddenly, the child turns and runs down the hall disappearing into Dalton's bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God, Dalton...no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Summoning every ounce of strength, Renai troops down the towards Dalton's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai pushes the door open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dalton lies in the center of the room on his gurney. The sound is his breathing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai surveys the room. It is empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bump...bump...bump...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She steps inside, glancing over at a cabinet. In the foot high space beneath it, a small white shoe protrudes sligh 44.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A child's shoe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heart pounding, Renai bends down, peering into the darkne under the cabinet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bump...bump...bump...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shoe does not have a foot in it. It is simply a disca shoe. There is no one under the cabinet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cabinet doors EXPLODE open as the child bursts out, giggling. Only we see that it is not a child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a DWARF. A man in child's clothing. The dwarf runs Renai as she LEAPS back. He runs out of the room, gigglin All is quiet again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bump...bump...bump...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai gets up, unsure of what to do. Numb with terror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUDDENLY-- the record pitches back to life, the volume startling. Renai JOLTS, falling backwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A darkened class room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An older janitor, NED (68), shoulders the door open, carr mop. He STARTS when he sees Josh, sitting at his desk in pale light of a desk lamp. Alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh...didn't see you there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry to scare you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you up to this late?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh holds up his flask of whisky. He's a bit soused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did all the bartenders who listen to your troubles go, Ned?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned nods sagely. He sets down his mop and grabs a chair, sitting in front of Josh with a sigh. He takes the flask. 45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never drink alone. If you take the dirty jokes out of drunkenness, all you're left with is the self loathing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He downs a hit from the flask, then hands it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need whisky for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bah. You people think too much. Used to be, if life threw a shitstorm at you, you'd grab the nearest umbrella. Your generation would spend a day googling what brand to buy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh laughs despite himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I probably would too. (beat; takes a drink) It's funny, I've always known I was the type of person that things didn't happen to. I made peace with it. I thought to myself, it's okay - I'll never win the lottery or climb Mount Everest...but I'll never get a rare tropical blood disease either. It works out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I'm the guy whose son is in a mysterious coma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things happen to everybody. Even to good people like you. And they're gonna keep happening the older you get, believe me. No use sittin' in the dark drinkin' over it. Go home. Be with your wife. Tell her your what's on your mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes the flask and has another swig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There sure as hell isn't any umbrellas `round here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh pulls up to the house. Turns off the car. 46.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An old Cadillac is sitting in the driveway. Josh clambers of his car and peers in through the window of the Cadilla quizzical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai is huddled on the couch in the living room, grippin knees to her chest. A man is sitting next to her; a hands soft-spoken Anglican priest, FATHER NATHANSON (40).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh enters. There are subtle changes in his coordination speech from the booze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the first line of a joke. Guy comes home to find his wife with a priest...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father Nathanson stands, as does Renai.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh, this is Liam Nathanson. A very old friend of mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you. I've heard a lot about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't say I've heard the same, Liam. At least I know you're not sleeping with her.

dialogues.speaker: LORRAINE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Don't be rude, Josh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh turns to see his mother, holding a tray of tea. He f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is going on here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should be going. Thank you so much for the tea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Liam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He clears his throat and exits, quickly and quietly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, would anyone mind telling me what the hell is going on here? 47.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please sit down, Joshua.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Joshua?" Oh Jesus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The melodramatic way in which you two are conducting yourselves right now is scaring the shit out of me, so just tell me what's wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing is wrong. We want to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody asks you to sit down unless something is wrong. If a doctor calls you into his office and asks you to sit down, you're fucked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no use, Lorraine. He's been drinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have not been drinking. Not enough that we can't talk to each other, Renai. And don't judge me in that bitchy tone, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He would never speak to me like that before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ. You're acting like I'm some lush who comes home and beats you with a belt. At least I'm speaking to you. You suddenly have to speak to a priest. Or my mother who, up until a couple of weeks ago, you couldn't stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're an asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your wife needs you. Now sit down and listen to her. I won't ask you again. 48.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh obeys. His mothers tone can still shut him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on, Renai. Tell him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This...thing that was in the other house. It followed us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh shifts in his seat. Agitated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let her speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw someone again today. In the house. It looked like a young boy. I followed it into Dalton's room... but it wasn't a child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This thing is here. I know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So...what? You called in a priest to get rid of it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know what else to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was this your idea?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It was mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've never been to a church in your life. Now you're inviting a priest into our home? I feel like I don't even know you right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a fantasy, and you need a therapist, not a member of the clergy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you... 49.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happening to Renai is real. I've seen it for myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came here today because last night I had a dream about this place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are FLOATING through the corridor, looking through Lorraine's POV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are inside her dream.

dialogues.speaker: LORRAINE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I was in this house...but it was late at night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The POV keeps moving, out of the kitchen and into the hal

dialogues.speaker: LORRAINE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I tried to be quiet. I didn't want to wake anybody. I was afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The POV floats down the hall, reaching a door. The door opens, revealing Josh and Renai, sleeping.

dialogues.speaker: LORRAINE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I looked into your bedroom. You were both asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The POV keeps moving down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: LORRAINE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I knew that I was asleep in the dream...but I could feel that someone was awake in the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We keep pushing on, reaching the door to Dalton's room.

dialogues.speaker: LORRAINE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I went into Dalton's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door pushes open. In the dark, we can see Dalton, in

dialogues.speaker: LORRAINE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: There was someone in there with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The POV turns to see a DARK FIGURE, standing in the corne

dialogues.speaker: LORRAINE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: A man was standing in the corner of the room.

dialogues.speaker: LORRAINE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I asked him who he was...he said he was a visitor. I asked him what he wanted...he said Dalton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lorraine is clearly unsettled by the dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can still hear that voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks up at Josh - and SCREAMS!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
