dialogues.text: Over Josh's shoulder, crouched down behind the couch and peeking up over the armrest at Lorraine, is a DIABOLICAL FIGURE. His face is PURE RED with smeared lipstick. His s is completely bald, yet tufts of hair dangle above his ea Other than his face, his skin is charcoal black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lorraine recoils back, utterly petrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lorraine stares eerily into his eyes. Frozen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai looks to Josh, who is at a total loss. She is cryin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help us...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His anger fades and he steps over and takes her in his ar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know how.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know somebody who can help...if you're willing to ask for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A battered van is parked in the driveway of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai and Josh stand in front of two men. They are silent 51.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shorter one is a wiry young man who looks like he spe most of his time in dark rooms. Not a member of the beach volleyball team. This is SPECS (32).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other is TUCKER (33), a larger man with scruffy facia hair. He is eating a Hot Pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you must be Josh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That wasn't psychic. Lorraine told me your name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Specs. (beat; spooky voice) I'm here to solve your problem. I'm just kidding with the voice. We take this very seriously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So is Elise coming or...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She won't be joining us yet. Usually we handle all the background stuff, then she gets involved when we have the facts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helps weed out the nutjobs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a little uncomfortable. Speaking for myself. I'm not used to this kind of stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We understand completely. Ninety six per cent of the people we deal with have had no experience with this type of phenomena before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes out a notepad and pen. 52.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would like to start by interviewing you both. Can we record your answers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah...sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My assistant will check different areas of the house for electrical anomalies. I'll get him started. Tucker, would you follow me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Specs leads Tucker into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Assistant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you not eat that in front of the clients?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Assistant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finish it in here. This industry gets laughed at enough as it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Specs is halfway through interviewing Josh and Renai.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you or any of your children suffer from epilepsy or autism?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I mean, our son...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. I heard about this from Lorraine. He is in a coma, the cause of which is unknown?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. 53.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do either of you habitually use drugs or alcohol?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No drugs at all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I take anti-depressants sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have a history of clinical depression?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a history. I've had bouts of it. In the past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai is uncomfortable. Specs makes a note. The camera be

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tucker, could you check the camera?

dialogues.speaker: TUCKER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I'm still assisting in the other room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whenever you're ready then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat. Tucker finally enters, adjusts the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Renai and Josh) He handles administration, I handle technical. It's an even split. He couldn't change a light bulb and I'm no good with paperwork. It bores me senseless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Specs clears his throat, peeved. Continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have any history of sexual abuse in the family?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I have to ask how this relates to our problem? 54.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nine times out of ten, when someone comes to us with a problem like this, it's because of an inward cause within the family unit...not a physical force outside of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Specs and Tucker mill around the room. Tucker is carrying small electronic device. He holds it against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tri-field meter. It measures DC fields and the natural electro magnetic environment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes old wiring can leak into the atmosphere. It can cause hallucinations, changes in energy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. It's a little more complicated than that, but, you know, you get the general idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's basically that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really, but whatever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tech stuff's not relevant to you anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's very relevant, but it's all good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tucker edges into the corridor. He switches out the light then takes what looks like a modified VIEW-MASTER TOY out his shoulder bag, holding it up to his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stalks down the corridor with it. All is quiet. 55.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TUCKER'S POV THROUGH VIEWMASTER - different filters highl different degrees of UV light. Each slide changes the readings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He approaches the grandfather clock. Another slide clicks into place - showing us TWO FIGURES. Standing beside the clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the negative light, they look like females.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tucker lowers the device. There is no one there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Specs packs up the video equipment, babbling to Josh and Renai.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Epilepsy in one of the children mostly. It's very common. If we approach things academically, it lets us find the genuinely interesting cases.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tucker backs into the room. Very slowly. He is afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we can call Elise now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh opens the door to see an elderly woman, ELISE RAINIE (73), who despite her years maintains a sprightly energy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is absolutely nothing morbid or dour about her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Rainier?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, my mother couldn't come, it's just me. Elise. You must be Lorraine's son? You've grown since I last saw you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last saw me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mother and I have been friends for a long time. 56.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elise steps inside. Renai, Tucker and Specs gather around Everyone becomes very subservient, like the Queen just ar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re Specs and Tucker) They're very good assistants but I can't get them to dress any better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. I'm Renai.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pleased to meet you. I'm Elise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elise takes her hat off and scans the room, taking a deep breath. Tucker jabbers, eager to please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We took Tri-field and EMF readings of the whole house. All the wiring, alarm clocks, radios, toasters, TV, record player, fuse box. Nothing went off the charts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the previous home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tucker and Specs look at each other. Oh shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tucker hadn't monitored that yet. I could jump on that this afternoon if you like? Make up for lost time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but who would work the equipment? I'll need to be there. You know what, don't even sweat it. I'll make myself available.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's fine, gentlemen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares up at the ceiling, as if seeing something they

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think bad wiring is the problem here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She drifts over to the bookshelf, her hand landing on the of photo albums Renai looked through in the opening scene

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm. 57.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai and Josh exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I walk through the house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven, do you have your sketchbook?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Specs hurriedly fishes a sketchbook and pencil out of his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I do. Yes, I do. Yes, yes. I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. We're going to need it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tells me what she sees and I draw it. It's the most important part of her process.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His drawings and my photos comprise her visual records.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Especially the drawings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's debatable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not debatable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is, but whatever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Onwards and upwards. Find me a ghost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elise begins walking through the house. Tucker and Specs trail her and we FOLLOW THEM into the--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --hallway. 58.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai and Josh stay back, sheepish. Elise stalks forward the front, surveying every nook and cranny of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elise stops suddenly. She is staring straight at a corner the hallway, next to the grandfather clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is something here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is where I saw it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elise calmly mutters something to Specs in a low voice, b we have trouble hearing it - only snatches of key words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...long hair...grey dress...her eyes are...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He immediately starts sketching. His line drawings are fa but detailed. Impressive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He outlines the wall, the ceiling lamp, the grandfather clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then something else...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two young women. Standing next to the grandfather clock, dressed in Amish garb. Even in the roughness of the drawi we can make out their pleading eyes and pale skin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tucker takes out a camera, snaps some shots. Josh and Ren step forward, seeing the sketch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elise keeps moving, heading straight for one door in particular. She stops, running her hand over the wood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I have permission to enter this room?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you could wait back there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh and Renai hug each other. Tucker lowers the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elise grips the door handle and turns it. 59.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door groans open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dalton is lying on his gurney, surrounded by the sluggish drone of hospital equipment. The curtains are drawn and t room is dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elise hesitates...then steps inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave the lights off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elise steps closer to Dalton. She runs her hands over his prone body. She shivers as she does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ripple of fear passes through her. Her breath quickens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly...very very slowly ...she gazes up at a corner of the ceiling. Her eyes WIDEN and the look on her face

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her arm raises up, her finger extending and pointing at t corner she is glaring at.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? What do you see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elise cups her hand over her mouth and whispers to Specs, keeping her eyes GLUED to the far corner of the ceiling. cannot hear what she is whispering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hand shaking, Specs feverishly starts to sketch. We canno see what he is drawing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you see?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The strokes of Specs' pencil become faster and rougher, keeping up with Elise's whispers. Sweat dots his forehead

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tucker glances at the drawing and steps back instinctivel He holds up his Viewmaster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POV THROUGH VIEWMASTER - we see the far corner of the cei change color as Tucker rotates the lenses inside...but nothing out of the ordinary appears. Just a ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me! 60.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Renai charges forward, snatching the sketch boo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The drawing is of a hideous form - crouched in the corner the ceiling, staring down at Dalton below. It is the RED- FACED DEMON Lorraine saw earlier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His naked body is charcoal black...whilst also strangely translucent, the veins visible underneath the flesh. A corpulent stomach juts out, as if he were pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrified, Renai flicks on the light --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- revealing nothing but an ordinary ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elise holds court in the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai and Josh hold each other, struggling to comprehend

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure if you are ready to hear this yet...but unfortunately I can't waste any time easing you into it. There is no time left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes a deep breath, preparing herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to know that this is what I believe and it may contradict a previous medical diagnosis. However, you called me here and I am taking that as an acceptance of my readings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your son...is not in a coma. His physical body is here, but his spiritual body is not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reason these disturbances followed you to a new home is because...it is not the house that is haunted. It is your son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is too much for Josh. Renai, however, wants to liste

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand... 61.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elise considers what she is about to say carefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever heard of astral projection?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of body experiences?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elise nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I call them travellers. These are people with the ability to leave their physical body and travel to different places in an astral form. To some degree, we all have the ability to do it...but most of us subconsciously suppress it or don't know how to access it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh shakes his head, agitated. Renai leans forward, desperate for an answer to her terror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dalton is...a very accomplished astral projector. He has been since he was very young. He's not afraid of his ability. And that lack of fear has led him to travel too far and become lost...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lost? Lost where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elise gazes up at the ceiling, as if looking into another

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In The Further.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Further is that place beyond our perception, beyond our understanding of the physical world that we can see and touch. It is a place without clocks or measurements, without past or future...an infinite realm that holds all of our dreams...and all of our nightmares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to look at them. 62.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is where Dalton is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai cries, unprepared for what she is hearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The problem is that with his astral body gone, he has left a physical body with us. An empty vessel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh can't meet her gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And there are entities that know this. They can smell it - the chance to live again. That is why they have gathered around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many are there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are five benevolent spirits. Five different entities for whom Dalton has become a most prized possession. They are trying to get inside his physical body...and they get closer with each passing day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her words hang in the air like gunsmoke. Pure fear course through Josh's eyes. He fidgets, agitated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then there are two entities who are...not benevolent. One of them takes the form of a man, the other...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds up the drawing that Specs di.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They work together, so desperate are they to possess Dalton. They are the closest of all the entities to getting inside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to scare you, but I have never, in all my years of doing this, experienced anything as terrifying as their presence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there a way to bring Dalton back? 63.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is something we could try. A way of calling him back. I would need your complete trust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh can't take it any more. He stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No. This has gone too far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said that you'd give her a chance!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have given her a chance, and I did that because I wanted to help you. But I cannot have somebody telling us that the reason our son is in a coma is because his soul is floating off somewhere in another dimension.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know this is hard to hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's not fair is what it is. You're preying on people's grief and vulnerability, which is really easy to do in a situation like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did we go to all the trouble of bringing them here if you're just going to reject what they say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I wanted to help you. To put your mind at ease, and if this helped, then great. But to drag Dalton into this? No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh, you're not being fair...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fair? How did the voice of reason become the bad guy here? Don't you see? You want to believe. Of course you do, honey, anybody would.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room goes quiet. Josh turns to Elise. 64.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I appreciate what you're trying to do. I really do. But I think it's dangerous to start throwing out false hope like this. I have to put my foot down. My wife is not...mentally well at the moment, and I have to keep at least one of her feet here in the real world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never believed me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, I'm on your side. But I genuinely think this is dangerous and frankly, a little exploitative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to Elise, Specs and Tucker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You come into a home with a seriously ill child, you make a tenuous connection between him and these experiences Renai is having and viola - the client starts crying because they're desperate to believe, the tears validate your power, thank you, that'll be six hundred dollars please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We reject more cases than we take. We're not out for money, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I know...look, I appreciate your interest and your time. I do. Thank you. Thank you very much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes to the front door, opening it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I completely understand. And I honestly don't blame you for reacting like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks to the door, followed by Specs and Tucker, who sling their bags over their shoulders sheepishly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, please...don't go. 65.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for your time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They exit. The door closes. They are gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai lies in bed, awake...a broken shell of her former s A bottle of anti-depressants sits on the bedside table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh enters the bedroom. Sits down beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at me for a second, honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't look up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you really believe what she said? In your heart of hearts, did you actually take what she was saying literally?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat of silence passes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think I don't want to believe in that stuff? Of course I do. It would make life a lot easier if I did. If I believed that some supernatural force was responsible for what's happened to our son...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe anything anymore, Josh. I used to. I used to believe that I could keep my children safe. I used to believe everything would be okay. To believe in something, you have to know it to be true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns and looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The things that have happened to me haven't confirmed any beliefs - they've done the opposite. They've made me question what I believe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've made me realize that maybe we don't know as much as we think we do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh paces, at his wits end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ask me if I believe what she said to be true and the answer is I don't know. But let me ask you this - in your heart of hearts, can you say for certain that it isn't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh lies beside Renai, who is sleeping. He is wide awake staring at the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets out of bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All is mute as Josh enters, skulking carefully through th darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The curtains lull in the slightest of breezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh stands over Dalton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares down at his sons body, then lets his gaze drift around the room...past the CLOSET, past the DRAWINGS pinn to the wall and the TOYBOX...all the way to the CORNER of ceiling that Elise was so frightened of. Josh's eyes dril into the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there something waiting there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, Josh sits down beside Dalton. He grips his sons

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you? Where did you go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you hear me? I'm begging you to show me that you can hear me...I don't know how to help you. Please tell me what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh's torment fills the air...but Dalton doesn't move. 67.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please God, please help me...give me my son back. I will do anything just to have him back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh studies Dalton's face for a response. Nothing. Not a twitch. He collapses forward onto Dalton. Holding him tig

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need him back. I need him to show me that he can hear me. Please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a moment, all we can hear is Josh's breathing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then...something happens. Something Josh doesn't see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dalton's face twitches. It is a very slight movement. Thi movement is followed by something that is hard to miss--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the tacks pinning one of Dalton's drawings to the begins to wind loose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It pops free, shooting across the room like a kernel of popcorn...followed by another tack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The second tack lands in Josh's lap. Puzzled, he picks it examining it. He looks up, his eye drawn to the picture o the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With total astonishment, he sees the two remaining tacks works themselves free, popping out of the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The drawing floats down to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh stoops down, picking it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a drawing split into two halves. The left half is a self portrait of Dalton, lying in bed, looking down from above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The right half is a depiction of outer space - squiggly s and bloated planets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dalton has drawn another version of himself on this side, flying above the house with another man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the bottom of the first drawing, Dalton has written `L night I watched myself sleep'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tear falls down Josh's face. He begins to cry. Deep and painful tears he has long pent up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beneath the second drawing, Dalton has written `Then I fl 68.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai's eyes flutter open. She glances over. No one is th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai shuffles into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh is sitting at the kitchen table, staring at Dalton's drawing. He hasn't slept and looks it. He looks up at her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai approaches Josh and they hug...holding on for dear

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lambert house is lit from within. Like a Jack-O-Lante

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Action stations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tucker sets up two stills camera's around Dalton's room, zipping back and forth between the two tripods. Specs ope up a kit, taking out his notepad and a pencil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small, circular table has been set up, adjacent to Dalt bed. Elise sits at the table, flanked on either side by J and Renai.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's most important is that you realize no two attempts are the same. I will be completely honest with you about the results, and if no dialogue is established, I will tell you. I am not in the business of embellishing success. What happens, happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh and Renai nod grimly, truly out of their depth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget the limits and laws and logic of this world. We are treading in a different place now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tucker finally sets his cameras and takes a seat in the c holding up a HAND-HELD VIDEO CAMERA. 69.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These still cameras are rigged to pick up changes in the atmosphere, electrical or temperature-wise. Don't be alarmed if they go off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything I say while I am in tune will be at a very low volume, so you won't hear any of it. Steven will write it down and repeat it for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Specs waits obediently at her side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on to each other, and stay focused. You'll see things you don't understand. Confusing things. Do not question them or speak in any way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to Specs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dim the lights please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tucker reaches up and dims the lights to a very low level

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elise closes her eyes, concentrating. She relaxes her hea as if meditating, letting it loll on her shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the cameras on the tripod goes off, bathing the ro in white light for a split second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elise inhales and exhales deeply, slipping away. Soon, sh very still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Specs nods to Tucker silently, then produces an odd looki device made from GREY CLOTH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It almost resembles a gas mask from World War 1, with a c shaped muzzle that fits over the mouth and nose. The snou the facemask is like an elongated elephant trunk, coiling outwards and ending in an old listening device, like an e version of a microphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Specs slips two hooks over Elise's ears and gently places device over her nose and mouth. He then takes a seat next her, behind Renai, who holds Elise's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Specs takes out his notepad and fixes a small apparatus around his neck that holds a flashlight in place. 70.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He flicks it on, then holds the microphone end of Elise's facemask up to his ear, a pencil gripped in the other han

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead silence descends over the group like a blanket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, we hear something lilt through the old microphone. is Elise's muttered whispers. Specs begins writing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai opens her eyes to peek at what he is scribbling in cursive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: we are calling out to you dalton Renai grips Josh's hand tightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are calling out to you Dalton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: tell us that you are safe tell us where you are

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell us that you are safe. Tell us where you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what seems like an eternity, all is quiet and still..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...until Elise's eyelids flutter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another unintelligible whisper drifts out of the micropho at Specs' ear. He writes. who's there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's there? it is your mother and father we have been looking for you

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is your mother and father. We have been looking for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long pause. Specs writes again, more intense this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: i need help i can't see in here

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need help...I can't see in here. 71.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: follow my voice dalton come back to us

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Follow my voice Dalton. Come back to us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another long pause. A little too long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why aren't you talking anymore dalton?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why aren't you talking anymore Dalton?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat. Tucker's camera flash goes off again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: if they hear me they'll hurt me

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If they hear me, they'll hurt me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: who will hurt you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who will hurt you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the man with fire on his face

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man with fire on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: can you find your way back to us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you find your way back to us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: there is no way out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no way out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: follow my voice dalton

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Follow my voice Dalton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: be quiet they'll hear you 72.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be quiet, they'll hear you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: they won't hear you just follow my voice

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They won't hear you, just follow my voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: they are coming they heard you help me helpme mom and dad please save me please come and get mepleasecomeandgetmecome Elise's head TWITCHES as Specs' writes furiously, trying keep up. His pencil finally SNAPS. He snatches up another

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: dalton are you there? dalton? An agonizing ocean of silence...then this furious scrawl:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: listen to me you filthy whore he isnt here you should not have come here you fucking bitch i will rip your cunt apart and eat the fucking innards that spill forth from it i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Specs writing begins to SHRED the paper as he writes furiously, the scrawl getting out of control. Sweat flies from his forehead as he struggles to get it all down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly a PIERCING SCREAM blasts through the microphone he jerks it away from his ear - then looks over at Elise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With UTTER DREAD, he sees that she is NO LONGER WEARING T MASK. She has taken it off and is panting heavily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scream continues through the mic, audible to everyone...then peters out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shocked silence follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh glances over at Dalton's bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is not in it. 73.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stunned, Josh turns back to the table--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His heart leaps out of his skin and so does Renai's as th both turn towards Dalton. Their son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dalton stares at them...not a trace of emotion on his fac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he reaches up and grips his bottom jaw with both han wrenching it downwards with almighty force and BREAKING H OWN JAW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai SCREAMS into the abyss as Dalton BELLOWS at them, s flying from his throat, his tongue hanging down over his dislocated jaw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stamps his foot and the table - and everyone sitting a it, Renai, Josh and Elise - go flying backwards as if pus by a hurricane, smashing into the wall with crushing powe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We realize that Dalton was not sitting at the table, but squatting down awkwardly. Painfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands up, then steps forward. As Josh and Renai watch his KNEE begins to BEND BACKWARDS, the tendons stretching snapping, the knee bending in the opposite direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His other knee follows and he steps forward - both knees bending back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Specs is rigid in his chair, rooted to the spot, notepad still in hand. When he looks up at Dalton, the flashlight under his chin shines in Dalton's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dalton ROARS and advances forward - SLAPPING Specs with t force of ten men. Specs reels backwards, hitting the wall smashing his head and crumpling like paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elise stands to face Dalton. The CAMERA FLASH goes off ag lighting the darkened room for a split second and showing Elise the lipstick-smeared face of a demon instead of Dalton's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tucker SHRINKS BACK as he captures all this with the vide

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dalton steps forward again and Elise CHARGES at him, grab Dalton by the hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave this vessel! Leave this vessel!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dalton BELLOWS again - a howl so course and ungodly that seems ripped straight from the bowels of Lucifer himself. 74.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dalton FLIES backwards, hitting the corner of the wall an then CLIMBING IT, arcing his body into the far corner of ceiling like an expert contortionist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hisses at them as the CAMERA FLASH fires AGAIN AND AGA showing them split second frames of the red faced CREATUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave this earthly body!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dalton shrieks again and somehow the force of the cry kno Elise down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room begins to shake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Books fly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The closet doors burst open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With terror, Elise looks over and sees several figures peering out from within the closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two are the women that Specs' drew. Another is a small ma dressed like a child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stare out at Elise, their eyes glinting in the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elise turns to see Josh. The camera flash STROBES repeate and gives us split-second glimpses of an OLD WOMAN, dress in Victorian era garb - standing directly behind Josh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then, with absolute fear, Renai sees the LONG HAIRED standing over her. He SCREAMS at her and pushes her again the wall, licking her. She cries out, terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the spirit world, crashing in around her, Elise pull herself off the floor and yells again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave his body!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dalton suddenly SPASMS, dropping out of the corner and hitting the floor like a rag doll dropped off a bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrified, Specs' scrambles over to the corner, flicking light switch. The room is instantly flooded with light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room has stopped shaking. The screaming has stopped. 75.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dalton!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai wrenches herself across the carpet and reaches Dalt limp body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dalton! Dalton!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She listens for breathing. His chest moves. He is still breathing. She holds him and cries. More desperate than e

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tucker, Specs and Elise convene in the kitchen, slumped amongst the boxes for the tech gear. All are in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel like a mountain climber who's been waiting his whole life to climb Everest, and now that I'm standing on the summit, I don't know what to do with myself...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you what we do with ourselves. We make a short list of our preferred media outlets, that's what.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds up his video camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hits play on a monitor that his video camera is cabled Chaotic images of Dalton from the previous scene SPIT to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEHIND DALTON, we can just make out the blurry image of t RED-FACED DEMON. Puppeteering Dalton from behind. Control his limbs like a human marionette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After all the years we've been dining out on morsels like a faucet that turns itself on and off...we finally have some empirical evidence of the real thing. Proof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hits pause on the video, freeze-framing the hellish im 76.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Proof? Proof of what? Nine tenths of the world believes that when you die, your soul ascends to sit with God. Would you be telling them something they didn't already know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is so not the point. This is not about religion. Here we have irrefutable evidence of a paranormal experience. Our job is to share it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, our job is not to alert the press and prove the existence of the `paranormal', as you call it. I'm not out to prove anything. I've known there was a higher plane ever since I was a little girl and I could play hopscotch with people whose names were inscribed on tombstones. What you call paranormal is a fact of life for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our job is to help people. The least we can do is spare them the indignity of Sixty Minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She snatches his camera away from him and stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, until they get their book deal...then you'll wish you'd listened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I won't, Tucker. I'll just be proud of you. You two stared down something that would crush most mortals tonight and you stood tall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They manage a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do we do now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We answer the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a knock at the front door. 77.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh sits with Renai's head in his lap. She is too traumatized to speak. Rain dribbles down the window pane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh gets up when he hears the knock at the door. Elise shuffles over to answer it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens the door to reveal Lorraine, wet from the downp

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elise steps aside and Lorraine walks in, gravely sedate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom...what are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I asked your mother to come over. I called her immediately after...the session. I told her to hurry over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lorraine's usual strong will has evaporated. She looks to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is something we must talk about. Sit down, Lorraine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lorraine follows orders, easing onto the sofa. Eyes down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thunder growls in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on. Tell him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lorraine swallows and starts talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reason...I knew to call Elise in this situation...the reason I know her so well...is because I called her myself once. Years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks up at Josh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To help you, Josh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? 78.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lorraine can't go on. Elise steps in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's no accident that your son is such a gifted traveller. The ability was handed down to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By his father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have returned to the opening scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are looking down on a sleeping child. Chest rising and falling with each breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is JOSH as a child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We move away from him, exploring the dark room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tucker and Specs enter the room, lingering at the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...I've never...done that before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you were about eight...you suffered night terrors. Awful fits of pure fear. You were terrified of an old woman who you said would come to visit you at night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again we return to the opening scene...floating down a lo hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A window at the end of the hall enlarges as we approach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone is standing in front of it. 79.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The murky silhouette of the figure turns and walks away. follow it, tentative. Turning a corner, we see the figure Standing in a doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we can make out the edges of the figure. It is an old woman. Hair in a Victorian bun. A corseted dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lorraine closes her eyes, struggling to go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dismissed your stories. Told you to grow up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I saw her for myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks to Elise, who nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hand trembling, Lorraine retrieves a packet from within h coat. The paper is yellowing. Faded. Soaked from the rain

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lorraine hands the packet to Josh, who is dumbfounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai peers over Josh's shoulder, at a Polaroid of a boy, about nine years old, sitting on a couch. Early 70s perio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a Young Josh. Behind him is the BLURRED OUTLINE OF FIGURE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh runs his finger over the shadow. His heart rate spee up. An old memory is coming back to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At first, I thought it was a camera problem. Then I saw her again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh flips to the next photo - it is another faded frame Josh as a youngster. This time he stands in an old kitche

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once again, there is a figure behind him - clearer this t but still hidden in silhouette. A step closer to Josh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh flips to the next picture. A BLACK AND WHITE shot of himself as a young boy, lying in bed. 80.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With dread, Josh sees the unmistakable features of an OLD WOMAN, crouching beside his bed. Staring at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In each photo, she got closer and closer to you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh flips to the next picture - in this one, Young Josh standing by a car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind him, the details of the Old Woman's dress are visi Her arm is extended...reaching out for Josh's neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai's hand flies to her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, I was so scared, I called Elise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweat pours down Josh's brow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lets the photographs flutter from his fingers, backing away. Fragments of memories rock his entire body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't...I don't remember any of this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've blocked it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But in the back of your mind, you're still afraid of having your picture taken, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh grabs the wall, weak at the knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've kept the photos hidden ever since then...until tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I advised Lorraine to hide them. To stop taking your picture. And to let you forget.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A parasite. She befriended your astral body, then drew you out into The Further, just as Dalton has been drawn out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she deceived you. All she wanted was an empty vessel. A physical body. Yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Josh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't want to make you remember this...I only do it for the sake of your son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A quiet descends over them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your son is out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you are the only one who can bring him back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh looks up at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long do we have before...that thing...takes him over completely?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All eyes are on Elise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you cannot reach him tonight, then he is gone forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights have been dimmed. Josh sits on a single person lounge chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elise sits opposite him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tucker and Specs set up around her, fixing their cameras place. Renai leans forward on the couch opposite, chewing nails to the quick. Lorraine is next to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember who you are and why you are traveling. Keep one foot in this world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh nods. Renai hugs him and they hold onto it. She whis to him, staring into his eyes. 82.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to know something...you have never been less than good enough for me. You've always been perfect for me. You're my best friend...my soulmate. I love you so much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you too. I have since the first time you looked at me. I don't exist without you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elise drifts over to the piano, lifting the METRONOME fro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sets it down in front of Josh, freeing the weighted s arm so it moves back and forth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close your eyes, Josh...and relax. Breathe deeply. Let all life around you fade out into the background...until the only thing you can hear is the ticking of the metronome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We PUSH IN on Josh, inhaling and exhaling. TICK...TICK...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Focus on a spot in the center of your forehead. Feel that spot getting further away as you drift off to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are now in an ECU of Josh. TICK...TICK...TICK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to relax your physical body and let the astral body gain strength...feel it rising out of your chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai watches, literally and figuratively on the edge of seat. Tucker and Specs take notes from the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh breathes deeply. Eyes shut tightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detach yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh's eyes open suddenly and he stands up, frustrated, marching across the living room. 83.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is useless...I have no idea what I'm doing and you just suddenly expect me to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns around and stops dead. His words trail off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees his own body, sitting in the armchair, eyes close Elise is sitting opposite, with her back to the Josh who now standing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The living room is exactly as it was - only Renai, Lorrai Tucker and Specs have disappeared. They are nowhere to be seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stunned into mute shock, Josh stares at his own body in t armchair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly, Elise turns her head away from the Josh in the ch staring eerily into the standing Josh's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She can see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you are free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep your guide, and a steady stride...and into The Further you go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns back to the Josh in the chair. The room seems t have darkened even more somehow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh turns and glares into the darkness of his hallway as yawns outwards, eventually swallowed by complete blacknes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is not in another world. He is in his own house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NOTE - The following scenes are not going to be "movie quiet". They will be inhumanly quiet. There will no score Only sound scape. This is another world and should feel s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh moves forward, gliding down the hall slowly. He look down and sees that his feet are slighty raised off the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is floating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves into the darkness of the hall...past the bedroom doors and closet doors. 84.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he floats past, he scans every darkened corner for the slightest trace of movement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches the front door. He moves towards it and as he it OPENS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His street beckons beyond the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh floats across his lawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are no people or cars on the street...it is as deso as a post-apocalyptic wasteland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some lights flicker from within the houses, but no moveme or signs of human forms. Only mist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh floats an inch above the road, moving down the stree

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One thing to notice is that there is a total lack of hori or city scape here...Josh's immediate surroundings are visible for about one hundred yards or so...anything beyo that, in any direction, fades into blackness. As if someo were shining a giant spotlight down on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai watches Josh. He is completely still...in a trance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyelids flutter as his eyeballs probe in all directio underneath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh keeps moving, his fear registering, even in this wor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks down at his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is frustrated that he can't move any faster. He concentrates with fierce intensity--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --and then watches as his feet touch the ground. 85.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to move faster, gaining control of his movement

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dalton?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of his voice is strangely dead - as if he were inside a soundproof recording studio. There are no walls angles for it to bounce off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dalton? Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a long time, there is nothing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...then he sees it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A figure...shrouded in shadow. Standing on the street cor with his back to Josh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh moves towards the figure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Closer. Closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man abruptly turns the corner without looking back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh glances around the corner. There is nobody there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He continues down the street. He sees a little girl. Far the distance, but close enough to focus on. She stands an stares...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...then turns and walks away. Gone...like an apparition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks to his right and sees--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind a curtain in one of the windows, back lit by candl light. As with the others, the shadow turns away and disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh walks towards the front door of the house. He reache and turns the handle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long corridor beckons. As with all of this world, it is dark here. 86.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh walks into the corridor, looking to his left and rig into empty rooms. Living rooms and bedrooms. Devoid of li

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The colors are muted...the palate drained. Only REDS and BLACKS pop out. Blood and darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh keeps moving down the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up ahead, he sees a figure run past the top of the hall, ignoring Josh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He presses forward, following the figure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dalton?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He glances into an empty kitchen. Food rots on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His footsteps have no sound as he continues on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dalton?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He passes a door that is partly open. He pushes it wide o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is small and empty. A strange room...like a stag

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A figure is sitting in the corner, facing the wall like a child being punished at school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh steps closer, cautious. Takes another step.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is Dalton?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He steps closer yet again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His hand reaches out to touch the figures back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...his fingers are almost grazing the figures shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soft laughter behind him. Josh glances back to look for t source.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When he turns back, the FIGURE IS GONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wheels around, seeing the small-statured figure of the DWARF that Renai encountered, stepping through the door o the room. 87.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh sidles back into the corridor. His pace is sluggish, dream-like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frustrated, he stops. Then turns to his left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man is not looking at him...only standing very close. neck lolls on his shoulders...around and around. He seems stuck on a loop. He is dressed in a fifties era suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know where Dalton is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man doesn't acknowledge him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do I have to put up with you? What a tramp. You call this a home? I work all day for this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He marches away, leaving Josh standing alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh keeps going, whirling around. He reaches a set of st The stairs descend into darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh squints into the dark, afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dalton? Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The low rumble of this place is the only reply. Josh turn walk away. A distant voice stops him.

dialogues.speaker: DALTON, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Dad...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh SNAPS back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The voice drifted from out of the darkness at the bottom the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh scurries down the creaky ramp towards it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The core of a rotten apple. The bowels of hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drenched in shadow, Josh fumbles forward into yet another corridor of this labyrinth. 88.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He realizes he knows where he is. He is in his OLD HOUSE. alternate world version of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lighting is different - it's darker. There are no sig of life. Water drips somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh stumbles forward, seeing an open door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh slinks into a darkened and dilapidated living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are THREE PEOPLE in here - a middle aged woman, a m aged man and a young girl. They are all FROZEN, standing place as if someone had hit the pause button on their lif

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman is in the middle of ironing. The man is sitting arm chair reading a newspaper. The girl is lying on the f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole scene looks like a macabre `Leave It To Beaver' tableau - a cheerful family frozen in time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh steps closer to the mother...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...hairs prickling up on his neck when he sees her BLINK. body moves slightly. She is not frozen - merely playing statues. Like a street performer keeping as still as poss

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh turns to the father. He is the same. His hand shakes struggling to hold the newspaper in place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He backs away from them, truly creeped out. His back hits window and he turns, peering through the glass down at th street below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A figure, hidden in silhouette, is gazing up at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh stalks into a kitchen off the living room. A weather door is adjacent to the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door is ajar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through it, Josh can see somebodies leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh approaches the door, prodding it open gently with hi finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a bedroom. A tattered cot sits against the wall. A YOUNG MAN (17) sits on the cot, holding a rifle. Like the others, he is trying to be completely still, as if on pau 89.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is having more trouble than the family, trembling slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking for my son, Dalton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy does not look up. Does not move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh retreats, scanning the kitchen. There are soiled pot the sink. Rotting food, but no bugs. Josh turns the fauce but no water comes forth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When he turns back, the YOUNG MAN is gone. No longer in h bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh glances back at the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Young Man is now standing inside the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again, he is frozen. Holding his rifle. Looking down at h family, who are now splayed out on the carpet, soaked in BLOOD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Each of them has a bullet hole in their head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Repulsed, Josh tip-toes past them. He looks down at the mother - a bullet wound in the center of her chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She blinks...still playing dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More corridors disappearing into darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh wrenches his hair in frustration. He boils over, screaming at the top of his lungs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His cry recedes into nothingness.

dialogues.speaker: DALTON, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Dad....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He heard that. Excited, he spins around, trying to determ where it came from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he does, he sees that the entire dead family is now gathered at the door to the living room. Watching him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He summons all his strength and starts running, backing a from them. 90.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drives himself to move faster and faster.

dialogues.speaker: DALTON, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Dad...help me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A figure suddenly appears at the end of the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is the LONG HAIRED MAN IN THE GREY JACKET. The man who terrorized Renai.

dialogues.speaker: LONG HAIRED MAN
dialogues.text: I hear you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He approaches.

dialogues.speaker: LONG HAIRED MAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I hear you, but you don't know what you've done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He licks his lips.

dialogues.speaker: LONG HAIRED MAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There is a place that you can't go to and this is that place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is only a few yards from Josh now. He SCREAMS with awe power, his spit flying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He CHARGES at Josh, screaming with hellfire fury.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh recoils, falling onto the floor, screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh's body JOLTS in the chair and he makes a noise somew between a scream and a moan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happening to him?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elise leans in, attempting to communicate with Josh. 91.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're stronger then they are, Josh. You are a living soul!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh struggles. The Long Haired Man attacks him viciously

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then something changes in Josh - he gets angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get...off..me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shoves the Long Haired Man back, pounding into him wit the strength of TEN MEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away from me! Leave now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frightened, the Long Haired Man retreats, backing away un he is swallowed up by the blackness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dalton!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh follows the voice to another stairwell in this Esche like maze of passageways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dalton!

dialogues.speaker: DALTON, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From darkness into baroque extravagance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh finds himself in a gilded chamber of long neglected opulence...as if a palace had been stormed, the occupants murdered and the place left to rot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mold caked pillars support a ceiling of gold flakes, the having rotted way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mirrors line the walls, their surface too clouded to see 92.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dalton...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He weaves between pillars, finally coming across a figure slumped on the floor in the corner like a dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is Dalton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh runs to him. His foot is chained to a PIPE behind hi the clamp binding his right ankle. He looks pale and sick looks like one of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm taking you back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees that Dalton is terrified. Looking over Josh's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He glances back, spotting an open door at the end of the ballroom, light spilling from within it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is somebody inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A grotesque form sits in front of an immense gold-rimmed mirror at a baroque powder table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is the RED-FACED creature seen by Elise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The creature daubs RED LIPSTICK onto its face, arching forward, glaring into the mirror, caking the make-up on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is littered with hundreds of discarded CHILDREN' TOYS - teddy bears, stuffed animals, dolls (including one white-faced, black-haired doll we recognize). They are scattered about like bones, collecting dust in the shadow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the creature stops what it is doing. It sees something in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What it sees is Josh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With horror, Josh watches as the Red-Faced Man stands up staggers to the door, peering through the crack at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh wrestles to free Dalton's leg from the chain. No goo 93.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind them the Red Faced Man opens the door. A rage unkn to humans is building up inside the creature. He hisses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me, dad...take this off me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The creature steps closer. Taking his time. Drool seeping from his mouth with each drunken, wayward lope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not really here. You're asleep in your bed in our home. Just stand up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's going to hurt me again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't real. You can do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's coming!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just stand up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dalton does - and suddenly finds that the chain is no lon attached to his foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Red Faced Man ROARS and the power of his breath sends them FLYING BACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This...issssss....real!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh smashes his head on a pillar, blood leaking from his head. The power of this demon far outweighs the others.

dialogues.speaker: RED-FACED MAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That...issss...my....boy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh scrambles to his feet and snatches up Dalton, carryi him to the door as the Red Faced Man pursues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh convulses in the chair, choking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help him! 94.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh surges down a corridor, carrying Dalton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Red-Faced Man hobbles up behind them, his rasping whe growing in volume.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're here now! With ussss!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh stampedes through the front door of the house - but instead of the street, he is facing another corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They spill into the second corridor, running again, racin past rows and rows of doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh twitches in his chair, sweat beading on his forehead

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ....ome....onnnnn...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elise paces in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've made contact. I know it. He's found your son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happens now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need them to come back. We need him to find us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tucker's equipment begins to shake on the table. The hang light above them quivers as if an earthquake were rattlin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A force is building in the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Josh and Dalton streak down the corridor, each door op and a different figure staggers out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grotesque figures...the solemn dead. Pale skin, hollow ey Their dead eyes drill into Josh's soul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They want what he has - life. 95.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They begin running - chasing Josh. Dozens of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh stops, seeing that the corridor seemingly has NO END yells in frustration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to get out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh's body SHUDDERS, the cry escaping his lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ....eeeeet out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room trembles again. Elise looks to Renai.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call out to him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh whips around, desperate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh follows the order - and hears it. A faint shout. A s call from another world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh, follow my voice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The voice seems to come from behind the door in front of Josh. He shoves it open--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renai glares at Josh's eyelids...as if he can see her thr them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Follow my voice. Come back to us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room stops trembling. All is very still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a moment, it is as if time has stopped. Nuclear silen Then...a drawer slides open in the corner of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lorraine and Renai gasp at this supernatural interruption 96.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Specs clambers to his feet, approaching the drawer. It contains a note pad and nothing else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
